titleStmt.title: Reasons humbly offered to the High Court of Parliament: shewing (if their honours think fit to lay a duty upon leather) what loss the King will sustain in His present customs, and how prejudicial it will be to all artificers in the kingdom using the cutting of leather, if leave be given to the merchant to draw back the new duty at the custom-house, of that which shall be exported unwrought.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the British Library.
